      43             :  * \todo XXX The IAX2 channel driver needs its native bridge
      44             :  * code converted to the new bridge technology scheme.
      45             :  *
      46             :  * \note The chan_dahdi native bridge code can be used as an
      47             :  * example.  It also appears that chan_iax2 also has a native
      48             :  * transfer check like chan_dahdi to eliminate tromboned calls.
      49             :  *
      50             :  * \note The existing native bridge code is marked with the
      51             :  * IAX2_NATIVE_BRIDGING conditional.
      52             :  */

     129             : /*** DOCUMENTATION
     130             :         <application name="IAX2Provision" language="en_US">
     131             :                 <synopsis>
     132             :                         Provision a calling IAXy with a given template.
     133             :                 </synopsis>
     134             :                 <syntax>
     135             :                         <parameter name="template">
     136             :                                 <para>If not specified, defaults to <literal>default</literal>.</para>
     137             :                         </parameter>
     138             :                 </syntax>
     139             :                 <description>
     140             :                         <para>Provisions the calling IAXy (assuming the calling entity is in fact an IAXy) with the
     141             :                         given <replaceable>template</replaceable>. Returns <literal>-1</literal> on error
     142             :                         or <literal>0</literal> on success.</para>
     143             :                 </description>
     144             :         </application>
     145             :         <function name="IAXPEER" language="en_US">
     146             :                 <synopsis>
     147             :                         Gets IAX peer information.
     148             :                 </synopsis>
     149             :                 <syntax>
     150             :                         <parameter name="peername" required="true">
     151             :                                 <enumlist>
     152             :                                         <enum name="CURRENTCHANNEL">
     153             :                                                 <para>If <replaceable>peername</replaceable> is specified to this value, return the IP address of the
     154             :                                                 endpoint of the current channel</para>
     155             :                                         </enum>
     156             :                                 </enumlist>
     157             :                         </parameter>
     158             :                         <parameter name="item">
     159             :                                 <para>If <replaceable>peername</replaceable> is specified, valid items are:</para>
     160             :                                 <enumlist>
     161             :                                         <enum name="ip">
     162             :                                                 <para>(default) The IP address.</para>
     163             :                                         </enum>
     164             :                                         <enum name="status">

     166             :                                         </enum>

     192             :                                 </enumlist>
     193             :                         </parameter>
     194             :                 </syntax>

     201             :         </function>

     204             :                         Sets or retrieves a remote variable.

     206             :                 <syntax>
     207             :                         <parameter name="varname" required="true" />
     208             :                 </syntax>

     371             : #define IAX_CAPABILITY_MEDBANDWIDTH (IAX_CAPABILITY_FULLBANDWIDTH & \
     372             :                      ~AST_FORMAT_SLIN &      \

     395             : #define IAX_CALLENCRYPTED(pvt) \

     397             : 
     398             : #define IAX_DEBUGDIGEST(msg, key) do { \
     399             :                 int idx; \
     400             :                 char digest[33] = ""; \
     401             :                 \
     402             :                 if (!iaxdebug) \
     403             :                         break; \
     404             :                 \
     405             :                 for (idx = 0; idx < 16; idx++) \
     406             :                         sprintf(digest + (idx << 1), "%02hhx", (unsigned char) key[idx]); \
     407             :                 \
     408             :                 ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, msg " IAX_COMMAND_RTKEY to rotate key to '%s'\n", digest); \
     409             :         } while(0)

     441             :         IAX_STATE_STARTED =                     (1 << 0),

     443             :         IAX_STATE_TBD =                         (1 << 2),
     444             : };

     450             : 
     451             : 
     452             : #define IAX_HASCALLERID         (uint64_t)(1LLU << 0)    /*!< CallerID has been specified */
     453             : #define IAX_DELME               (uint64_t)(1LLU << 1)    /*!< Needs to be deleted */
     454             : #define IAX_TEMPONLY            (uint64_t)(1LLU << 2)    /*!< Temporary (realtime) */
     455             : #define IAX_TRUNK               (uint64_t)(1LLU << 3)    /*!< Treat as a trunk */
     456             : #define IAX_NOTRANSFER          (uint64_t)(1LLU << 4)    /*!< Don't native bridge */
     457             : #define IAX_USEJITTERBUF        (uint64_t)(1LLU << 5)    /*!< Use jitter buffer */
     458             : #define IAX_DYNAMIC             (uint64_t)(1LLU << 6)    /*!< dynamic peer */
     459             : #define IAX_SENDANI             (uint64_t)(1LLU << 7)    /*!< Send ANI along with CallerID */
     460             : #define IAX_RTSAVE_SYSNAME      (uint64_t)(1LLU << 8)    /*!< Save Systname on Realtime Updates */
     461             : #define IAX_ALREADYGONE         (uint64_t)(1LLU << 9)    /*!< Already disconnected */
     462             : #define IAX_PROVISION           (uint64_t)(1LLU << 10)   /*!< This is a provisioning request */
     463             : #define IAX_QUELCH              (uint64_t)(1LLU << 11)   /*!< Whether or not we quelch audio */
     464             : #define IAX_ENCRYPTED           (uint64_t)(1LLU << 12)   /*!< Whether we should assume encrypted tx/rx */
     465             : #define IAX_KEYPOPULATED        (uint64_t)(1LLU << 13)   /*!< Whether we have a key populated */
     466             : #define IAX_CODEC_USER_FIRST    (uint64_t)(1LLU << 14)   /*!< are we willing to let the other guy choose the codec? */
     467             : #define IAX_CODEC_NOPREFS       (uint64_t)(1LLU << 15)   /*!< Force old behaviour by turning off prefs */
     468             : #define IAX_CODEC_NOCAP         (uint64_t)(1LLU << 16)   /*!< only consider requested format and ignore capabilities*/
     469             : #define IAX_RTCACHEFRIENDS      (uint64_t)(1LLU << 17)   /*!< let realtime stay till your reload */
     470             : #define IAX_RTUPDATE            (uint64_t)(1LLU << 18)   /*!< Send a realtime update */
     471             : #define IAX_RTAUTOCLEAR         (uint64_t)(1LLU << 19)   /*!< erase me on expire */
     472             : #define IAX_RTIGNOREREGEXPIRE   (uint64_t)(1LLU << 21)   /*!< When using realtime, ignore registration expiration */
     473             : #define IAX_TRUNKTIMESTAMPS     (uint64_t)(1LLU << 22)   /*!< Send trunk timestamps */
     474             : #define IAX_TRANSFERMEDIA       (uint64_t)(1LLU << 23)   /*!< When doing IAX2 transfers, transfer media only */
     475             : #define IAX_MAXAUTHREQ          (uint64_t)(1LLU << 24)   /*!< Maximum outstanding AUTHREQ restriction is in place */
     476             : #define IAX_DELAYPBXSTART       (uint64_t)(1LLU << 25)   /*!< Don't start a PBX on the channel until the peer sends us a response, so that we've achieved a three-way handshake with them before sending voice or anything else */
     477             : #define IAX_ALLOWFWDOWNLOAD     (uint64_t)(1LLU << 26)   /*!< Allow the FWDOWNL command? */
     478             : #define IAX_IMMEDIATE           (uint64_t)(1LLU << 27)   /*!< Allow immediate off-hook to extension s */
     479             : #define IAX_SENDCONNECTEDLINE   (uint64_t)(1LLU << 28)   /*!< Allow sending of connected line updates */
     480             : #define IAX_RECVCONNECTEDLINE   (uint64_t)(1LLU << 29)   /*!< Allow receiving of connected line updates */
     481             : #define IAX_FORCE_ENCRYPT       (uint64_t)(1LLU << 30)   /*!< Forces call encryption, if encryption not possible hangup */
     482             : #define IAX_SHRINKCALLERID      (uint64_t)(1LLU << 31)   /*!< Turn on and off caller id shrinking */
     483             : static int global_rtautoclear = 120;
     484             : 
     485             : static int reload_config(int forced_reload);
     486             : 
     487             : /*!
     488             :  * \brief Call token validation settings.
     489             :  */
     490             : enum calltoken_peer_enum {
     491             :         /*! \brief Default calltoken required unless the ip is in the ignorelist */
     492             :         CALLTOKEN_DEFAULT = 0,
     493             :         /*! \brief Require call token validation. */
     494             :         CALLTOKEN_YES = 1,
     495             :         /*! \brief Require call token validation after a successful registration
     496             :          *         using call token validation occurs. */
     497             :         CALLTOKEN_AUTO = 2,
     498             :         /*! \brief Do not require call token validation. */
     499             :         CALLTOKEN_NO = 3,
     500             : };
     501             :

     576             :         int maxms;                                      /*!< Max ms we will accept for the host to be up, 0 to not monitor */

     692             : /* We use the high order bit as the validated flag, and the lower 15 as the

     694             : typedef uint16_t callno_entry;

     900             : 
     901             : #define PTR_TO_CALLNO_ENTRY(a) ((uint16_t)(unsigned long)(a))
     902             : #define CALLNO_ENTRY_TO_PTR(a) ((void *)(unsigned long)(a))
     903             : 
     904             : #define CALLNO_ENTRY_SET_VALIDATED(a) ((a) |= 0x8000)
     905             : #define CALLNO_ENTRY_IS_VALIDATED(a)  ((a) & 0x8000)
     906             : #define CALLNO_ENTRY_GET_CALLNO(a)    ((a) & 0x7FFF)
     907             : 
     908             : struct call_number_pool {
     909             :         size_t capacity;
     910             :         size_t available;
     911             :         callno_entry numbers[IAX_MAX_CALLS / 2 + 1];
     912             : };
     913             : 
     914             : AST_MUTEX_DEFINE_STATIC(callno_pool_lock);
     915             : 
     916             : /*! table of available call numbers */
     917             : static struct call_number_pool callno_pool;
     918             : 
     919             : /*! table of available trunk call numbers */
     920             : static struct call_number_pool callno_pool_trunk;
     921             : 
     922             : /*!
     923             :  * \brief a list of frames that may need to be retransmitted
     924             :  *
     925             :  * \note The contents of this list do not need to be explicitly destroyed
     926             :  * on module unload.  This is because all active calls are destroyed, and
     927             :  * all frames in this queue will get destroyed as a part of that process.
     928             :  *
     929             :  * \note Contents protected by the iaxsl[] locks
     930             :  */
     931             : static AST_LIST_HEAD_NOLOCK(, iax_frame) frame_queue[IAX_MAX_CALLS];
     932             : 
     933             : static struct ast_taskprocessor *transmit_processor;
     934             : 
     935             : static int randomcalltokendata;
     936             : 
     937             : static time_t max_calltoken_delay = 10;
     938             : 
     939             : /*!
     940             :  * This module will get much higher performance when doing a lot of
     941             :  * user and peer lookups if the number of buckets is increased from 1.
     942             :  * However, to maintain old behavior for Asterisk 1.4, these are set to
     943             :  * 1 by default.  When using multiple buckets, search order through these
     944             :  * containers is considered random, so you will not be able to depend on
     945             :  * the order the entires are specified in iax.conf for matching order. */
     946             : #ifdef LOW_MEMORY
     947             : #define MAX_PEER_BUCKETS 17
     948             : #else
     949             : #define MAX_PEER_BUCKETS 563
     950             : #endif
     951             : static struct ao2_container *peers;
     952             : 
     953             : #define MAX_USER_BUCKETS MAX_PEER_BUCKETS
     954             : static struct ao2_container *users;
     955             : 
     956             : /*! Table containing peercnt objects for every ip address consuming a callno */
     957             : static struct ao2_container *peercnts;
     958             : 
     959             : /*! Table containing custom callno limit rules for a range of ip addresses. */
     960             : static struct ao2_container *callno_limits;
     961             : 
     962             : /*! Table containing ip addresses not requiring calltoken validation */
     963             : static struct ao2_container *calltoken_ignores;
     964             : 
     965             : static uint16_t DEFAULT_MAXCALLNO_LIMIT = 2048;
     966             : 
     967             : static uint16_t DEFAULT_MAXCALLNO_LIMIT_NONVAL = 8192;
     968             : 
     969             : static uint16_t global_maxcallno;
     970             : 
     971             : /*! Total num of call numbers allowed to be allocated without calltoken validation */
     972             : static uint16_t global_maxcallno_nonval;
     973             : 
     974             : static uint16_t total_nonval_callno_used = 0;
     975             : 
     976             : /*! peer connection private, keeps track of all the call numbers
     977             :  *  consumed by a single ip address */
     978             : struct peercnt {
     979             :         /*! ip address consuming call numbers */
     980             :         struct ast_sockaddr addr;
     981             :         /*! Number of call numbers currently used by this ip address */
     982             :         uint16_t cur;
     983             :         /*! Max call numbers allowed for this ip address */
     984             :         uint16_t limit;
     985             :         /*! Specifies whether limit is set by a registration or not, if so normal
     986             :          *  limit setting rules do not apply to this address. */
     987             :         unsigned char reg;
     988             : };
     989             : 
     990             : /*! used by both callno_limits and calltoken_ignores containers */
     991             : struct addr_range {

    1144             : /*!
    1145             :  * \brief Another container of iax2_pvt structures
    1146             :  *
    1147             :  * Active IAX2 pvt structs are also stored in this container, if they are a part
    1148             :  * of an active call where we know the remote side's call number.  The reason
    1149             :  * for this is that incoming media frames do not contain our call number.  So,
    1150             :  * instead of having to iterate the entire iaxs array, we use this container to
    1151             :  * look up calls where the remote side is using a given call number.
    1152             :  */

    1316             : 
    1317             : /*!
    1318             :  * \internal
    1319             :  * \brief Obtain the owner channel lock if the owner exists.
    1320             :  *
    1321             :  * \param callno IAX2 call id.
    1322             :  *
    1323             :  * \note Assumes the iaxsl[callno] lock is already obtained.
    1324             :  *
    1325             :  * \note
    1326             :  * IMPORTANT NOTE!!!  Any time this function is used, even if
    1327             :  * iaxs[callno] was valid before calling it, it may no longer be
    1328             :  * valid after calling it.  This function may unlock and lock
    1329             :  * the mutex associated with this callno, meaning that another
    1330             :  * thread may grab it and destroy the call.
    1331             :  *
    1332             :  * \return Nothing
    1333             :  */
    1334       19801 : static void iax2_lock_owner(int callno)
    1335             : {
    1336             :         for (;;) {
    1337       19801 :                 if (!iaxs[callno] || !iaxs[callno]->owner) {
    1338             :                         /* There is no owner lock to get. */
    1339             :                         break;
    1340             :                 }
    1341       19799 :                 if (!ast_channel_trylock(iaxs[callno]->owner)) {
    1342             :                         /* We got the lock */
    1343       19656 :                         break;
    1344             :                 }
    1345             :                 /* Avoid deadlock by pausing and trying again */
    1346         143 :                 DEADLOCK_AVOIDANCE(&iaxsl[callno]);
    1347             :         }
    1348       19658 : }
    1349             : 
    1350             : /*!
    1351             :  * \internal
    1352             :  * \brief Check if a control subtype is allowed on the wire.
    1353             :  *
    1354             :  * \param subtype Control frame subtype to check if allowed to/from the wire.
    1355             :  *
    1356             :  * \retval non-zero if allowed.
    1357             :  */
    1358         177 : static int iax2_is_control_frame_allowed(int subtype)
    1359             : {
    1360         177 :         enum ast_control_frame_type control = subtype;
    1361             :         int is_allowed;
    1362             : 
    1363             :         /*
    1364             :          * Note: If we compare the enumeration type, which does not have any
    1365             :          * negative constants, the compiler may optimize this code away.
    1366             :          * Therefore, we must perform an integer comparison here.
    1367             :          */
    1368         177 :         if (subtype == -1) {
    1369          60 :                 return -1;
    1370             :         }
    1371             : 
    1372             :         /* Default to not allowing control frames to pass. */
    1373         117 :         is_allowed = 0;
    1374             : 
    1375             :         /*
    1376             :          * The switch default is not present in order to take advantage
    1377             :          * of the compiler complaining of a missing enum case.
    1378             :          */
    1379         117 :         switch (control) {
    1380             :         /*
    1381             :          * These control frames make sense to send/receive across the link.
    1382             :          */
    1383          66 :         case AST_CONTROL_HANGUP:
    1384             :         case AST_CONTROL_RING:
    1385             :         case AST_CONTROL_RINGING:
    1386             :         case AST_CONTROL_ANSWER:

    1408          66 :                 break;
    1409             : 
    1410             :         /*
    1411             :          * These control frames do not make sense to send/receive across the link.
    1412             :          */
    1413          51 :         case _XXX_AST_CONTROL_T38:
    1414             :                 /* The control value is deprecated in favor of AST_CONTROL_T38_PARAMETERS. */
    1415             :         case AST_CONTROL_SRCUPDATE:
    1416             :                 /* Across an IAX link the source is still the same. */
    1417             :         case AST_CONTROL_TRANSFER:
    1418             :                 /* A success/fail status report from calling ast_transfer() on this machine. */
    1419             :         case AST_CONTROL_CC:
    1420             :                 /* The payload contains pointers that are valid for the sending machine only. */
    1421             :         case AST_CONTROL_SRCCHANGE:
    1422             :                 /* Across an IAX link the source is still the same. */
    1423             :         case AST_CONTROL_READ_ACTION:
    1424             :                 /* The action can only be done by the sending machine. */
    1425             :         case AST_CONTROL_END_OF_Q:
    1426             :                 /* This frame would cause the call to unexpectedly hangup. */
    1427             :         case AST_CONTROL_UPDATE_RTP_PEER:
    1428             :                 /* Only meaningful across a bridge on this machine for direct-media exchange. */
    1429             :         case AST_CONTROL_PVT_CAUSE_CODE:
    1430             :                 /* Intended only for the sending machine's local channel structure. */
    1431             :         case AST_CONTROL_MASQUERADE_NOTIFY:
    1432             :                 /* Intended only for masquerades when calling ast_indicate_data(). */
    1433             :         case AST_CONTROL_STREAM_TOPOLOGY_REQUEST_CHANGE:
    1434             :                 /* Intended only for internal stream topology manipulation. */
    1435             :         case AST_CONTROL_STREAM_TOPOLOGY_CHANGED:
    1436             :                 /* Intended only for internal stream topology change notification. */

    1581       20773 : static struct iax2_thread *find_idle_thread(void)

    1688             : /*
    1689             :  * \brief Acquire the iaxsl[callno] if call exists and not having ongoing hangup.
    1690             :  * \param callno Call number to lock.
    1691             :  * \return 0 If call disappeared or has ongoing hangup procedure. 1 If call found and mutex is locked.
    1692             :  */
    1693          48 : static int iax2_lock_callno_unless_destroyed(int callno)
    1694             : {
    1695          48 :         ast_mutex_lock(&iaxsl[callno]);
    1696             : 
    1697             :         /* We acquired the lock; but the call was already destroyed (we came after full hang up procedures)
    1698             :          * or destroy initiated (in middle of hang up procedure. */

    1700           0 :                 ast_debug(3, "I wanted to lock callno %d, but it is dead or going to die.\n", callno);
    1701           0 :                 ast_mutex_unlock(&iaxsl[callno]);
    1702           0 :                 return 0;
    1703             :         }
    1704             : 
    1705             :         /* Lock acquired, and callno is alive and kicking. */
    1706          48 :         return 1;
    1707             : }

    1808        1191 : static unsigned char compress_subclass(iax2_format subclass)
    1809             : {
    1810             :         int x;
    1811        1191 :         int power=-1;
    1812             :         /* If it's 64 or smaller, just return it */
    1813        1191 :         if (subclass < IAX_FLAG_SC_LOG)
    1814        1191 :                 return subclass;
    1815             :         /* Otherwise find its power */
    1816           0 :         for (x = 0; x < IAX_MAX_SHIFT; x++) {
    1817           0 :                 if (subclass & (1LL << x)) {
    1818           0 :                         if (power > -1) {
    1819           0 :                                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Can't compress subclass %lld\n", (long long) subclass);
    1820           0 :                                 return 0;
    1821             :                         } else
    1822           0 :                                 power = x;
    1823             :                 }
    1824             :         }
    1825           0 :         return power | IAX_FLAG_SC_LOG;
    1826             : }
    1827             : 
    1828        1297 : static iax2_format uncompress_subclass(unsigned char csub)
    1829             : {
    1830             :         /* If the SC_LOG flag is set, return 2^csub otherwise csub */
    1831        1297 :         if (csub & IAX_FLAG_SC_LOG) {
    1832             :                 /* special case for 'compressed' -1 */
    1833          30 :                 if (csub == 0xff)
    1834          30 :                         return -1;
    1835             :                 else
    1836           0 :                         return 1LL << (csub & ~IAX_FLAG_SC_LOG & IAX_MAX_SHIFT);
    1837             :         }
    1838             :         else
    1839        1267 :                 return csub;
    1840             : }

    2081             : /*!\note Assumes the lock on the pvt is already held, when
    2082             :  * iax2_destroy_helper() is called. */
    2083         158 : static void iax2_destroy_helper(struct chan_iax2_pvt *pvt)
    2084             : {
    2085             :         /* Decrement AUTHREQ count if needed */
    2086         158 :         if (ast_test_flag64(pvt, IAX_MAXAUTHREQ)) {
    2087             :                 struct iax2_user *user;
    2088             : 
    2089          13 :                 user = ao2_find(users, pvt->username, OBJ_KEY);
    2090          13 :                 if (user) {
    2091          13 :                         ast_atomic_fetchadd_int(&user->curauthreq, -1);
    2092          13 :                         user_unref(user);
    2093             :                 }
    2094             : 
    2095          13 :                 ast_clear_flag64(pvt, IAX_MAXAUTHREQ);
    2096             :         }
    2097             : 
    2098             : 
    2099             :         /* Mark call destroy initiated flag. */
    2100         158 :         pvt->destroy_initiated = 1;
    2101             : 
    2102             :         /*
    2103             :          * Schedule deleting the scheduled (but didn't run yet) PINGs or LAGRQs.
    2104             :          * Already running tasks will be terminated because of destroy_initiated.
    2105             :          *
    2106             :          * Don't call AST_SCHED_DEL from this thread for pingid and lagid because
    2107             :          * it leads to a deadlock between the scheduler thread callback locking
    2108             :          * the callno mutex and this thread which holds the callno mutex one or
    2109             :          * more times.  It is better to have another thread delete the scheduled
    2110             :          * callbacks which doesn't lock the callno mutex.
    2111             :          */
    2112         158 :         iax2_sched_add(sched, 0, iax2_delete_from_sched, (void*)(long)pvt->pingid);
    2113         158 :         iax2_sched_add(sched, 0, iax2_delete_from_sched, (void*)(long)pvt->lagid);
    2114             : 
    2115         158 :         pvt->pingid = -1;
    2116         158 :         pvt->lagid = -1;

    2118         158 :         AST_SCHED_DEL(sched, pvt->autoid);

    2328           0 : static int make_trunk(unsigned short callno, int locked)
    2329             : {
    2330             :         int x;
    2331           0 :         int res= 0;
    2332             :         callno_entry entry;
    2333           0 :         if (iaxs[callno]->oseqno) {
    2334           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Can't make trunk once a call has started!\n");
    2335           0 :                 return -1;
    2336             :         }
    2337           0 :         if (callno >= TRUNK_CALL_START) {
    2338           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Call %d is already a trunk\n", callno);
    2339           0 :                 return -1;
    2340             :         }
    2341             : 
    2342           0 :         if (get_unused_callno(
    2343             :                         CALLNO_TYPE_TRUNK,
    2344           0 :                         CALLNO_ENTRY_IS_VALIDATED(iaxs[callno]->callno_entry),
    2345             :                         &entry)) {
    2346           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to trunk call: Insufficient space\n");
    2347           0 :                 return -1;
    2348             :         }
    2349             : 
    2350           0 :         x = CALLNO_ENTRY_GET_CALLNO(entry);
    2351           0 :         ast_mutex_lock(&iaxsl[x]);

    2354             :          * \note We delete these before switching the slot, because if
    2355             :          * they fire in the meantime, they will generate a warning.
    2356             :          */
    2357           0 :         AST_SCHED_DEL(sched, iaxs[callno]->pingid);

    2490             : {
    2491             :         struct addr_range *addr_range;
    2492           0 :         struct iax2_peer *peer = NULL;

    2494             :         /* if no username is given, check for guest accounts */
    2495           0 :         const char *find = S_OR(name, "guest");

    2497           0 :         int optional = 0;
    2498           0 :         enum calltoken_peer_enum calltoken_required = CALLTOKEN_DEFAULT;
    2499             :         /* There are only two cases in which calltoken validation is not required.
    2500             :          * Case 1. sin falls within the list of address ranges specified in the calltoken optional table and
    2501             :          *         the peer definition has not set the requirecalltoken option.
    2502             :          * Case 2. Username is a valid peer/user, and that peer has requirecalltoken set either auto or no.
    2503             :          */
    2504             : 
    2505             :         /* ----- Case 1 ----- */
    2506           0 :         if ((addr_range = ao2_callback(calltoken_ignores, 0, addr_range_match_address_cb, addr))) {
    2507           0 :                 ao2_ref(addr_range, -1);
    2508           0 :                 optional = 1;
    2509             :         }

    2513           0 :                 calltoken_required = user->calltoken_required;
    2514           0 :         } else if ((subclass == IAX_COMMAND_NEW) && (user = realtime_user(find, addr))) {
    2515           0 :                 calltoken_required = user->calltoken_required;
    2516           0 :         } else if ((subclass != IAX_COMMAND_NEW) && (peer = find_peer(find, 0))) {
    2517           0 :                 calltoken_required = peer->calltoken_required;
    2518           0 :         } else if ((subclass != IAX_COMMAND_NEW) && (peer = realtime_peer(find, addr))) {
    2519           0 :                 calltoken_required = peer->calltoken_required;
    2520             :         }
    2521             : 
    2522           0 :         if (peer) {
    2523           0 :                 peer_unref(peer);
    2524             :         }

    2526           0 :                 user_unref(user);

    2617             : 
    2618             : /*!
    2619             :  * \internal
    2620             :  * \brief adds an ip to the peercnts table, increments connection count if it already exists
    2621             :  *
    2622             :  * \details First searches for the address in the peercnts table.  If found
    2623             :  * the current count is incremented.  If not found a new peercnt is allocated
    2624             :  * and linked into the peercnts table with a call number count of 1.
    2625             :  */
    2626         106 : static int peercnt_add(struct ast_sockaddr *addr)
    2627             : {
    2628             :         struct peercnt *peercnt;
    2629         106 :         int res = 0;
    2630             :         struct peercnt tmp;
    2631             : 
    2632         106 :         ast_sockaddr_copy(&tmp.addr, addr);
    2633             : 
    2634             :         /* Reasoning for peercnts container lock:  Two identical ip addresses
    2635             :          * could be added by different threads at the "same time". Without the container
    2636             :          * lock, both threads could alloc space for the same object and attempt
    2637             :          * to link to table.  With the lock, one would create the object and link
    2638             :          * to table while the other would find the already created peercnt object
    2639             :          * rather than creating a new one. */
    2640         106 :         ao2_lock(peercnts);
    2641         106 :         if ((peercnt = ao2_find(peercnts, &tmp, OBJ_POINTER))) {
    2642          84 :                 ao2_lock(peercnt);
    2643          22 :         } else if ((peercnt = ao2_alloc(sizeof(*peercnt), NULL))) {
    2644          22 :                 ao2_lock(peercnt);
    2645             :                 /* create and set defaults */
    2646          22 :                 ast_sockaddr_copy(&peercnt->addr, addr);
    2647          22 :                 set_peercnt_limit(peercnt);
    2648             :                 /* guarantees it does not go away after unlocking table
    2649             :                  * ao2_find automatically adds this */
    2650          22 :                 ao2_link(peercnts, peercnt);
    2651             :         } else {
    2652           0 :                 ao2_unlock(peercnts);
    2653           0 :                 return -1;
    2654             :         }
    2655             : 
    2656             :         /* check to see if the address has hit its callno limit.  If not increment cur. */
    2657         106 :         if (peercnt->limit > peercnt->cur) {
    2658         106 :                 peercnt->cur++;
    2659         106 :                 ast_debug(1, "ip callno count incremented to %d for %s\n", peercnt->cur, ast_sockaddr_stringify_addr(addr));
    2660             :         } else { /* max num call numbers for this peer has been reached! */
    2661           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "maxcallnumber limit of %d for %s has been reached!\n", peercnt->limit, ast_sockaddr_stringify_addr(addr));
    2662           0 :                 res = -1;
    2663             :         }
    2664             : 
    2665             :         /* clean up locks and ref count */
    2666         106 :         ao2_unlock(peercnt);
    2667         106 :         ao2_unlock(peercnts);
    2668         106 :         ao2_ref(peercnt, -1); /* decrement ref from find/alloc, only the container ref remains. */
    2669             : 
    2670         106 :         return res;
    2671             : }
    2672             : 
    2673             : /*!
    2674             :  * \internal
    2675             :  * \brief decrements a peercnts table entry
    2676             :  */
    2677         106 : static void peercnt_remove(struct peercnt *peercnt)
    2678             : {
    2679             :         struct ast_sockaddr addr;
    2680             : 
    2681         106 :         ast_sockaddr_copy(&addr, &peercnt->addr);
    2682             : 
    2683             :         /*
    2684             :          * Container locked here since peercnt may be unlinked from
    2685             :          * list.  If left unlocked, peercnt_add could try and grab this
    2686             :          * entry from the table and modify it at the "same time" this
    2687             :          * thread attemps to unlink it.
    2688             :          */
    2689         106 :         ao2_lock(peercnts);
    2690         106 :         peercnt->cur--;
    2691         106 :         ast_debug(1, "ip callno count decremented to %d for %s\n", peercnt->cur, ast_sockaddr_stringify_addr(&addr));
    2692             :         /* if this was the last connection from the peer remove it from table */
    2693         106 :         if (peercnt->cur == 0) {
    2694          22 :                 ao2_unlink(peercnts, peercnt);/* decrements ref from table, last ref is left to scheduler */
    2695             :         }
    2696         106 :         ao2_unlock(peercnts);
    2697         106 : }
    2698             : 
    2699             : /*!

    2732             :  * \internal
    2733             :  * \brief Create callno_limit entry based on configuration

    2735           0 : static void build_callno_limits(struct ast_variable *v)
    2736             : {
    2737           0 :         struct addr_range *addr_range = NULL;
    2738             :         struct addr_range tmp;
    2739             :         struct ast_ha *ha;
    2740             :         int limit;
    2741             :         int error;
    2742             :         int found;
    2743             : 
    2744           0 :         for (; v; v = v->next) {
    2745           0 :                 limit = -1;
    2746           0 :                 error = 0;
    2747           0 :                 found = 0;
    2748           0 :                 ha = ast_append_ha("permit", v->name, NULL, &error);
    2749             : 
    2750             :                 /* check for valid config information */
    2751           0 :                 if (error) {
    2752           0 :                         ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Call number limit for %s could not be added, Invalid address range\n.", v->name);
    2753           0 :                         continue;
    2754           0 :                 } else if ((sscanf(v->value, "%d", &limit) != 1) || (limit < 0)) {
    2755           0 :                         ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Call number limit for %s could not be added. Invalid limit %s\n.", v->name, v->value);
    2756           0 :                         ast_free_ha(ha);
    2757           0 :                         continue;
    2758             :                 }
    2759             : 
    2760           0 :                 ast_copy_ha(ha, &tmp.ha);
    2761             :                 /* find or create the addr_range */
    2762           0 :                 if ((addr_range = ao2_find(callno_limits, &tmp, OBJ_POINTER))) {
    2763           0 :                         ao2_lock(addr_range);
    2764           0 :                         found = 1;
    2765           0 :                 } else if (!(addr_range = ao2_alloc(sizeof(*addr_range), NULL))) {
    2766           0 :                         ast_free_ha(ha);
    2767           0 :                         return; /* out of memory */
    2768             :                 }
    2769             : 
    2770             :                 /* copy over config data into addr_range object */
    2771           0 :                 ast_copy_ha(ha, &addr_range->ha); /* this is safe because only one ha is possible for each limit */
    2772           0 :                 ast_free_ha(ha); /* cleanup the tmp ha */
    2773           0 :                 addr_range->limit = limit;
    2774           0 :                 addr_range->delme = 0;
    2775             : 
    2776             :                 /* cleanup */
    2777           0 :                 if (found) {
    2778           0 :                         ao2_unlock(addr_range);
    2779             :                 } else {
    2780           0 :                         ao2_link(callno_limits, addr_range);
    2781             :                 }
    2782           0 :                 ao2_ref(addr_range, -1); /* decrement ref from ao2_find and ao2_alloc, only container ref remains */
    2783             :         }
    2784             : }

    2888             :                                 trunk_pool_avail);
    2889           0 :                 } else if (a->argc == 5 && !found) {
    2890           0 :                         ast_cli(a->fd, "No call number table entries for %s found\n", a->argv[4] );
    2891             :                 }
    2892             : 
    2893             : 
    2894           0 :                 return CLI_SUCCESS;
    2895           0 :         default:
    2896           0 :                 return NULL;
    2897             :         }
    2898             : }
    2899             : 
    2900         106 : static int get_unused_callno(enum callno_type type, int validated, callno_entry *entry)
    2901             : {
    2902         106 :         struct call_number_pool *pool = NULL;
    2903             :         callno_entry swap;
    2904             :         size_t choice;
    2905             : 
    2906         106 :         switch (type) {
    2907         106 :         case CALLNO_TYPE_NORMAL:
    2908         106 :                 pool = &callno_pool;
    2909         106 :                 break;
    2910           0 :         case CALLNO_TYPE_TRUNK:
    2911           0 :                 pool = &callno_pool_trunk;
    2912           0 :                 break;
    2913           0 :         default:
    2914           0 :                 ast_assert(0);
    2915           0 :                 break;
    2916             :         }
    2917             : 
    2918             :         /* If we fail, make sure this has a defined value */
    2919         106 :         *entry = 0;
    2920             : 
    2921             :         /* We lock here primarily to ensure thread safety of the
    2922             :          * total_nonval_callno_used check and increment */
    2923         106 :         ast_mutex_lock(&callno_pool_lock);
    2924             : 
    2925             :         /* Bail out if we don't have any available call numbers */
    2926         106 :         if (!pool->available) {
    2927           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Out of call numbers\n");
    2928           0 :                 ast_mutex_unlock(&callno_pool_lock);
    2929           0 :                 return 1;
    2930             :         }
    2931             : 
    2932             :         /* Only a certain number of non-validated call numbers should be allocated.
    2933             :          * If there ever is an attack, this separates the calltoken validating users
    2934             :          * from the non-calltoken validating users. */
    2935         106 :         if (!validated && total_nonval_callno_used >= global_maxcallno_nonval) {
    2936           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING,
    2937             :                         "NON-CallToken callnumber limit is reached. Current: %d Max: %d\n",
    2938             :                         total_nonval_callno_used,
    2939             :                         global_maxcallno_nonval);
    2940           0 :                 ast_mutex_unlock(&callno_pool_lock);
    2941           0 :                 return 1;
    2942             :         }
    2943             : 
    2944             :         /* We use a modified Fisher-Yates-Durstenfeld Shuffle to maintain a list of
    2945             :          * available call numbers.  The array of call numbers begins as an ordered
    2946             :          * list from 1 -> n, and we keep a running tally of how many remain unclaimed
    2947             :          * - let's call that x.  When a call number is needed we pick a random index
    2948             :          * into the array between 0 and x and use that as our call number.  In a
    2949             :          * typical FYD shuffle, we would swap the value that we are extracting with
    2950             :          * the number at x, but in our case we swap and don't touch the value at x
    2951             :          * because it is effectively invisible.  We rely on the rest of the IAX2 core
    2952             :          * to return the number to us at some point.  Finally, we decrement x by 1
    2953             :          * which establishes our new unused range.
    2954             :          *
    2955             :          * When numbers are returned to the pool, we put them just past x and bump x
    2956             :          * by 1 so that this number is now available for re-use. */
    2957             : 
    2958         106 :         choice = ast_random() % pool->available;
    2959             : 
    2960         106 :         *entry = pool->numbers[choice];
    2961         106 :         swap = pool->numbers[pool->available - 1];
    2962             : 
    2963         106 :         pool->numbers[choice] = swap;
    2964         106 :         pool->available--;
    2965             : 
    2966         106 :         if (validated) {
    2967         106 :                 CALLNO_ENTRY_SET_VALIDATED(*entry);
    2968             :         } else {
    2969           0 :                 total_nonval_callno_used++;
    2970             :         }
    2971             : 
    2972         106 :         ast_mutex_unlock(&callno_pool_lock);
    2973             : 
    2974         106 :         return 0;
    2975             : }
    2976             : 
    2977           0 : static int replace_callno(const void *obj)
    2978             : {
    2979           0 :         callno_entry entry = PTR_TO_CALLNO_ENTRY(obj);
    2980             :         struct call_number_pool *pool;
    2981             : 
    2982             :         /* We lock here primarily to ensure thread safety of the
    2983             :          * total_nonval_callno_used check and decrement */
    2984           0 :         ast_mutex_lock(&callno_pool_lock);
    2985             : 
    2986           0 :         if (!CALLNO_ENTRY_IS_VALIDATED(entry)) {
    2987           0 :                 if (total_nonval_callno_used) {
    2988           0 :                         total_nonval_callno_used--;
    2989             :                 } else {
    2990           0 :                         ast_log(LOG_ERROR,
    2991             :                                 "Attempted to decrement total non calltoken validated "
    2992             :                                 "callnumbers below zero.  Callno is: %d\n",
    2993             :                                 CALLNO_ENTRY_GET_CALLNO(entry));
    2994             :                 }
    2995             :         }
    2996             : 
    2997           0 :         if (CALLNO_ENTRY_GET_CALLNO(entry) < TRUNK_CALL_START) {
    2998           0 :                 pool = &callno_pool;
    2999             :         } else {
    3000           0 :                 pool = &callno_pool_trunk;
    3001             :         }
    3002             : 
    3003           0 :         ast_assert(pool->capacity > pool->available);
    3004             : 
    3005             :         /* This clears the validated flag */
    3006           0 :         entry = CALLNO_ENTRY_GET_CALLNO(entry);
    3007             : 
    3008           0 :         pool->numbers[pool->available] = entry;
    3009           0 :         pool->available++;
    3010             : 
    3011           0 :         ast_mutex_unlock(&callno_pool_lock);
    3012             : 
    3013           0 :         return 0;
    3014             : }
    3015             : 
    3016        1115 : static int create_callno_pools(void)
    3017             : {
    3018             :         uint16_t i;
    3019             : 
    3020        1115 :         callno_pool.available = callno_pool_trunk.available = 0;
    3021             : 
    3022             :         /* We start at 2.  0 and 1 are reserved. */
    3023    18267045 :         for (i = 2; i < TRUNK_CALL_START; i++) {
    3024    18265930 :                 callno_pool.numbers[callno_pool.available] = i;
    3025    18265930 :                 callno_pool.available++;
    3026             :         }
    3027             : 
    3028    18269275 :         for (i = TRUNK_CALL_START; i < IAX_MAX_CALLS; i++) {
    3029    18268160 :                 callno_pool_trunk.numbers[callno_pool_trunk.available] = i;
    3030    18268160 :                 callno_pool_trunk.available++;
    3031             :         }
    3032             : 
    3033        1115 :         callno_pool.capacity = callno_pool.available;
    3034        1115 :         callno_pool_trunk.capacity = callno_pool_trunk.available;

    3036        1115 :         ast_assert(callno_pool.capacity && callno_pool_trunk.capacity);

    3041             : /*!
    3042             :  * \internal
    3043             :  * \brief Schedules delayed removal of iax2_pvt call number data
    3044             :  *
    3045             :  * \note After MIN_REUSE_TIME has passed for a destroyed iax2_pvt, the callno is
    3046             :  * available again, and the address from the previous connection must be decremented
    3047             :  * from the peercnts table.  This function schedules these operations to take place.
    3048             :  */
    3049         106 : static void sched_delay_remove(struct ast_sockaddr *addr, callno_entry entry)
    3050             : {
    3051             :         int i;
    3052             :         struct peercnt *peercnt;
    3053             :         struct peercnt tmp;
    3054             : 
    3055         106 :         ast_sockaddr_copy(&tmp.addr, addr);

    3058             :                 /* refcount is incremented with ao2_find.  keep that ref for the scheduler */
    3059         106 :                 ast_debug(1, "schedule decrement of callno used for %s in %d seconds\n", ast_sockaddr_stringify_addr(addr), MIN_REUSE_TIME);

    3061         106 :                 if (i == -1) {
    3062           0 :                         ao2_ref(peercnt, -1);
    3063             :                 }
    3064             :         }

    3237             : 
    3238             : /*!
    3239             :  * \brief Queue a frame to a call's owning asterisk channel
    3240             :  *
    3241             :  * \pre This function assumes that iaxsl[callno] is locked when called.
    3242             :  *
    3243             :  * \note IMPORTANT NOTE!!! Any time this function is used, even if iaxs[callno]
    3244             :  * was valid before calling it, it may no longer be valid after calling it.
    3245             :  * This function may unlock and lock the mutex associated with this callno,
    3246             :  * meaning that another thread may grab it and destroy the call.
    3247             :  */
    3248       19359 : static int iax2_queue_frame(int callno, struct ast_frame *f)
    3249             : {
    3250       19359 :         iax2_lock_owner(callno);
    3251       19359 :         if (iaxs[callno] && iaxs[callno]->owner) {
    3252       19357 :                 ast_queue_frame(iaxs[callno]->owner, f);
    3253       19357 :                 ast_channel_unlock(iaxs[callno]->owner);
    3254             :         }
    3255       19359 :         return 0;
    3256             : }
    3257             : 
    3258             : /*!
    3259             :  * \brief Queue a hold frame on the ast_channel owner

    3304             : /*!

    3309             :  *

    3311             :  *

    3313             :  * was valid before calling it, it may no longer be valid after calling it.

    3315             :  * meaning that another thread may grab it and destroy the call.

    3317          90 : static int iax2_queue_hangup(int callno)
    3318             : {
    3319          90 :         iax2_lock_owner(callno);
    3320          90 :         if (iaxs[callno] && iaxs[callno]->owner) {
    3321          90 :                 ast_queue_hangup(iaxs[callno]->owner);
    3322          90 :                 ast_channel_unlock(iaxs[callno]->owner);
    3323             :         }
    3324          90 :         return 0;

    3326             : 
    3327             : /*!
    3328             :  * \note This function assumes that iaxsl[callno] is locked when called.
    3329             :  *
    3330             :  * \note IMPORTANT NOTE!!! Any time this function is used, even if iaxs[callno]
    3331             :  * was valid before calling it, it may no longer be valid after calling it.
    3332             :  * This function calls iax2_queue_frame(), which may unlock and lock the mutex
    3333             :  * associated with this callno, meaning that another thread may grab it and destroy the call.
    3334             :  */
    3335       19345 : static int __do_deliver(void *data)
    3336             : {
    3337             :         /* Just deliver the packet by using queueing.  This is called by
    3338             :           the IAX thread with the iaxsl lock held. */
    3339       19345 :         struct iax_frame *fr = data;
    3340       19345 :         fr->retrans = -1;
    3341       19345 :         ast_clear_flag(&fr->af, AST_FRFLAG_HAS_TIMING_INFO);

    3454         144 : static void iax2_destroy(int callno)
    3455             : {
    3456         144 :         struct chan_iax2_pvt *pvt = NULL;

    3463             :                  * called twice, we get the (previously) familiar FRACK! errors in
    3464             :                  * devmode, from the scheduler.  An alternative to this approach is to
    3465             :                  * reset the scheduler entries to -1 when they're deleted in
    3466             :                  * iax2_destroy_helper().  That approach was previously decided to be
    3467             :                  * "wrong" because "the memory is going to be deallocated anyway.  Why
    3468             :                  * should we be resetting those values?" */
    3469             :                 iax2_destroy_helper(pvt);

    3785             : /*! \brief  peer_status: Report Peer status in character string */
    3786             : /*      returns 1 if peer is online, -1 if unmonitored */
    3787           0 : static int peer_status(struct iax2_peer *peer, char *status, int statuslen)
    3788             : {
    3789           0 :         int res = 0;

    3791           0 :                 if (peer->lastms < 0) {
    3792           0 :                         ast_copy_string(status, "UNREACHABLE", statuslen);
    3793           0 :                 } else if (peer->lastms > peer->maxms) {
    3794           0 :                         snprintf(status, statuslen, "LAGGED (%d ms)", peer->lastms);
    3795           0 :                         res = 1;
    3796           0 :                 } else if (peer->lastms) {
    3797           0 :                         snprintf(status, statuslen, "OK (%d ms)", peer->lastms);
    3798           0 :                         res = 1;
    3799             :                 } else {
    3800           0 :                         ast_copy_string(status, "UNKNOWN", statuslen);
    3801             :                 }
    3802             :         } else {

    3804           0 :                 res = -1;
    3805             :         }
    3806           0 :         return res;

    4066             : static unsigned int calc_rxstamp(struct chan_iax2_pvt *p, unsigned int offset);
    4067             : 
    4068       19345 : static void unwrap_timestamp(struct iax_frame *fr)
    4069             : {
    4070             :         /* Video mini frames only encode the lower 15 bits of the session
    4071             :          * timestamp, but other frame types (e.g. audio) encode 16 bits. */
    4072       19345 :         const int ts_shift = (fr->af.frametype == AST_FRAME_VIDEO) ? 15 : 16;
    4073       19345 :         const int lower_mask = (1 << ts_shift) - 1;
    4074       19345 :         const int upper_mask = ~lower_mask;
    4075       19345 :         const int last_upper = iaxs[fr->callno]->last & upper_mask;
    4076             : 
    4077       19345 :         if ( (fr->ts & upper_mask) == last_upper ) {
    4078       19345 :                 const int x = fr->ts - iaxs[fr->callno]->last;
    4079       19345 :                 const int threshold = (ts_shift == 15) ? 25000 : 50000;
    4080             : 
    4081       19345 :                 if (x < -threshold) {
    4082             :                         /* Sudden big jump backwards in timestamp:
    4083             :                            What likely happened here is that miniframe timestamp has circled but we haven't
    4084             :                            gotten the update from the main packet.  We'll just pretend that we did, and
    4085             :                            update the timestamp appropriately. */
    4086           0 :                         fr->ts = (last_upper + (1 << ts_shift)) | (fr->ts & lower_mask);
    4087           0 :                         if (iaxdebug)
    4088           0 :                                 ast_debug(1, "schedule_delivery: pushed forward timestamp\n");
    4089       19345 :                 } else if (x > threshold) {
    4090             :                         /* Sudden apparent big jump forwards in timestamp:
    4091             :                            What's likely happened is this is an old miniframe belonging to the previous
    4092             :                            top 15 or 16-bit timestamp that has turned up out of order.
    4093             :                            Adjust the timestamp appropriately. */
    4094           0 :                         fr->ts = (last_upper - (1 << ts_shift)) | (fr->ts & lower_mask);
    4095           0 :                         if (iaxdebug)
    4096           0 :                                 ast_debug(1, "schedule_delivery: pushed back timestamp\n");
    4097             :                 }
    4098             :         }
    4099       19345 : }
    4100             : 
    4101             : static int get_from_jb(const void *p);
    4102             : 
    4103           0 : static void update_jbsched(struct chan_iax2_pvt *pvt)

    4105             :         int when;
    4106             :

    4111           0 :         if (when <= 0) {
    4112             :                 /* XXX should really just empty until when > 0.. */
    4113           0 :                 when = 1;
    4114             :         }
    4115             : 
    4116           0 :         pvt->jbid = iax2_sched_replace(pvt->jbid, sched, when, get_from_jb,
    4117           0 :                 CALLNO_TO_PTR(pvt->callno));

    4120           0 : static void __get_from_jb(const void *p)
    4121             : {
    4122           0 :         int callno = PTR_TO_CALLNO(p);
    4123           0 :         struct chan_iax2_pvt *pvt = NULL;
    4124             :         struct iax_frame *fr;
    4125             :         jb_frame frame;
    4126             :         int ret;
    4127             :         long ms;
    4128             :         long next;
    4129           0 :         struct timeval now = ast_tvnow();
    4130             : 
    4131             :         /* Make sure we have a valid private structure before going on */
    4132           0 :         ast_mutex_lock(&iaxsl[callno]);
    4133           0 :         pvt = iaxs[callno];
    4134           0 :         if (!pvt) {
    4135             :                 /* No go! */
    4136           0 :                 ast_mutex_unlock(&iaxsl[callno]);
    4137           0 :                 return;
    4138             :         }
    4139             : 
    4140           0 :         pvt->jbid = -1;
    4141             : 
    4142             :         /* round up a millisecond since ast_sched_runq does; */
    4143             :         /* prevents us from spinning while waiting for our now */
    4144             :         /* to catch up with runq's now */
    4145           0 :         now.tv_usec += 1000;
    4146             : 
    4147           0 :         ms = ast_tvdiff_ms(now, pvt->rxcore);

    4149           0 :         if(ms >= (next = jb_next(pvt->jb))) {

    4154           0 :                 case JB_OK:
    4155           0 :                         fr = frame.data;
    4156           0 :                         __do_deliver(fr);
    4157             :                         /* __do_deliver() can cause the call to disappear */
    4158           0 :                         pvt = iaxs[callno];
    4159           0 :                         break;
    4160           0 :                 case JB_INTERP:
    4161             :                 {
    4162           0 :                         struct ast_frame af = { 0, };
    4163             : 
    4164             :                         /* create an interpolation frame */
    4165           0 :                         af.frametype = AST_FRAME_VOICE;
    4166           0 :                         af.subclass.format = voicefmt;
    4167           0 :                         af.samples  = frame.ms * (ast_format_get_sample_rate(voicefmt) / 1000);
    4168           0 :                         af.src  = "IAX2 JB interpolation";
    4169           0 :                         af.delivery = ast_tvadd(pvt->rxcore, ast_samp2tv(next, 1000));
    4170           0 :                         af.offset = AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET;
    4171             : 
    4172             :                         /* queue the frame:  For consistency, we would call __do_deliver here, but __do_deliver wants an iax_frame,
    4173             :                          * which we'd need to malloc, and then it would free it.  That seems like a drag */
    4174           0 :                         if (!ast_test_flag64(iaxs[callno], IAX_ALREADYGONE)) {

    4176             :                                 /* iax2_queue_frame() could cause the call to disappear */

    4186             :                         /* do nothing */
    4187           0 :                         break;
    4188           0 :                 default:
    4189             :                         /* shouldn't happen */
    4190           0 :                         break;
    4191             :                 }
    4192           0 :         }
    4193           0 :         if (pvt)
    4194           0 :                 update_jbsched(pvt);
    4195           0 :         ast_mutex_unlock(&iaxsl[callno]);
    4196             : }
    4197             : 
    4198           0 : static int get_from_jb(const void *data)
    4199             : {
    4200             : #ifdef SCHED_MULTITHREADED
    4201           0 :         if (schedule_action(__get_from_jb, data))
    4202             : #endif
    4203           0 :                 __get_from_jb(data);
    4204           0 :         return 0;
    4205             : }
    4206             : 
    4207             : /*!
    4208             :  * \note This function assumes fr->callno is locked
    4209             :  *
    4210             :  * \note IMPORTANT NOTE!!! Any time this function is used, even if iaxs[callno]
    4211             :  * was valid before calling it, it may no longer be valid after calling it.
    4212             :  */
    4213       19345 : static int schedule_delivery(struct iax_frame *fr, int updatehistory, int fromtrunk, unsigned int *tsout)
    4214             : {
    4215             :         int type, len;
    4216             :         int ret;
    4217       19345 :         int needfree = 0;
    4218             : 
    4219             :         /*
    4220             :          * Clear fr->af.data if there is no data in the buffer.  Things
    4221             :          * like AST_CONTROL_HOLD without a suggested music class must
    4222             :          * have a NULL pointer.
    4223             :          */
    4224       19345 :         if (!fr->af.datalen) {
    4225         273 :                 memset(&fr->af.data, 0, sizeof(fr->af.data));
    4226             :         }
    4227             : 
    4228             :         /* Attempt to recover wrapped timestamps */
    4229       19345 :         unwrap_timestamp(fr);
    4230             :

    4277         677 : static int transmit_frame(void *data)
    4278             : {
    4279         677 :         struct iax_frame *fr = data;
    4280             :

    4284             :

    4286         677 :                 send_packet(fr);
    4287             :         }

    4289         677 :         if (fr->retries < 0) {
    4290           0 :                 ast_mutex_unlock(&iaxsl[fr->callno]);
    4291             :                 /* No retransmit requested */
    4292           0 :                 iax_frame_free(fr);
    4293             :         } else {
    4294             :                 /* We need reliable delivery.  Schedule a retransmission */
    4295         677 :                 AST_LIST_INSERT_TAIL(&frame_queue[fr->callno], fr, list);
    4296         677 :                 fr->retries++;

    4298         677 :                 ast_mutex_unlock(&iaxsl[fr->callno]);
    4299             :         }
    4300             :

    4302             : }

    4739          53 : static unsigned int iax2_datetime(const char *tz)
    4740             : {
    4741          53 :         struct timeval t = ast_tvnow();
    4742             :         struct ast_tm tm;
    4743             :         unsigned int tmp;
    4744          53 :         ast_localtime(&t, &tm, ast_strlen_zero(tz) ? NULL : tz);
    4745          53 :         tmp  = (tm.tm_sec >> 1) & 0x1f;                       /* 5 bits of seconds */
    4746          53 :         tmp |= (tm.tm_min & 0x3f) << 5;                       /* 6 bits of minutes */
    4747          53 :         tmp |= (tm.tm_hour & 0x1f) << 11;             /* 5 bits of hours */
    4748          53 :         tmp |= (tm.tm_mday & 0x1f) << 16;             /* 5 bits of day of month */
    4749          53 :         tmp |= ((tm.tm_mon + 1) & 0xf) << 21;         /* 4 bits of month */
    4750          53 :         tmp |= ((tm.tm_year - 100) & 0x7f) << 25;     /* 7 bits of year */
    4751          53 :         return tmp;
    4752             : }

    4793          53 : static void add_empty_calltoken_ie(struct chan_iax2_pvt *pvt, struct iax_ie_data *ied)
    4794             : {
    4795             :         /* first make sure their are two empty bytes left in ied->buf */

    4799          53 :                 pvt->calltoken_ie_len = 2;

    4802             : 
    4803          53 : static void resend_with_token(int callno, struct iax_frame *f, const char *newtoken)
    4804             : {
    4805          53 :         struct chan_iax2_pvt *pvt = iaxs[callno];
    4806          53 :         int frametype = f->af.frametype;
    4807          53 :         int subclass = f->af.subclass.integer;
    4808             :         struct {
    4809             :                 struct ast_iax2_full_hdr fh;
    4810             :                 struct iax_ie_data ied;
    4811          53 :         } data = {
    4812             :                 .ied.buf = { 0 },
    4813             :                 .ied.pos = 0,
    4814             :         };
    4815             :         /* total len - header len gives us the frame's IE len */
    4816          53 :         int ie_data_pos = f->datalen - sizeof(struct ast_iax2_full_hdr);
    4817             : 
    4818          53 :         if (!pvt) {
    4819           0 :                 return;  /* this should not be possible if called from socket_process() */
    4820             :         }
    4821             : 
    4822             :         /*
    4823             :          * Check to make sure last frame sent is valid for call token resend
    4824             :          * 1. Frame should _NOT_ be encrypted since it starts the IAX dialog
    4825             :          * 2. Frame should _NOT_ already have a destination callno
    4826             :          * 3. Frame must be a valid iax_frame subclass capable of starting dialog
    4827             :          * 4. Pvt must have a calltoken_ie_len which represents the number of
    4828             :          *    bytes at the end of the frame used for the previous calltoken ie.
    4829             :          * 5. Pvt's calltoken_ie_len must be _LESS_ than the total IE length
    4830             :          * 6. Total length of f->data must be _LESS_ than size of our data struct
    4831             :          *    because f->data must be able to fit within data.
    4832             :          */
    4833          53 :         if (f->encmethods || f->dcallno || !iax2_allow_new(frametype, subclass, 0)
    4834          53 :                 || !pvt->calltoken_ie_len || (pvt->calltoken_ie_len > ie_data_pos) ||
    4835          53 :                 (f->datalen > sizeof(data))) {
    4836             : 
    4837           0 :                 return;  /* ignore resend, token was not valid for the dialog */
    4838             :         }
    4839             : 
    4840             :         /* token is valid
    4841             :          * 1. Copy frame data over
    4842             :          * 2. Redo calltoken IE, it will always be the last ie in the frame.
    4843             :          *    NOTE: Having the ie always be last is not protocol specified,
    4844             :          *    it is only an implementation choice.  Since we only expect the ie to
    4845             :          *    be last for frames we have sent, this can no way be affected by
    4846             :          *    another end point.
    4847             :          * 3. Remove frame from queue
    4848             :          * 4. Free old frame
    4849             :          * 5. Clear previous seqnos
    4850             :          * 6. Resend with CALLTOKEN ie.
    4851             :          */
    4852             : 
    4853             :         /* ---1.--- */
    4854          53 :         memcpy(&data, f->data, f->datalen);
    4855          53 :         data.ied.pos = ie_data_pos;
    4856             : 
    4857             :         /* ---2.--- */
    4858             :         /* move to the beginning of the calltoken ie so we can write over it */
    4859          53 :         data.ied.pos -= pvt->calltoken_ie_len;
    4860          53 :         iax_ie_append_str(&data.ied, IAX_IE_CALLTOKEN, newtoken);
    4861             : 
    4862             :         /* make sure to update token length incase it ever has to be stripped off again */
    4863          53 :         pvt->calltoken_ie_len = data.ied.pos - ie_data_pos; /* new pos minus old pos tells how big token ie is */
    4864             : 
    4865             :         /* ---3.--- */
    4866          53 :         AST_LIST_REMOVE(&frame_queue[callno], f, list);
    4867             : 
    4868             :         /* ---4.--- */
    4869          53 :         iax2_frame_free(f);
    4870             : 
    4871             :         /* ---5.--- */
    4872          53 :         pvt->oseqno = 0;
    4873          53 :         pvt->rseqno = 0;
    4874          53 :         pvt->iseqno = 0;
    4875          53 :         pvt->aseqno = 0;
    4876          53 :         if (pvt->peercallno) {
    4877          53 :                 remove_by_peercallno(pvt);
    4878          53 :                 pvt->peercallno = 0;
    4879             :         }
    4880             : 
    4881             :         /* ---6.--- */
    4882          53 :         send_command(pvt, AST_FRAME_IAX, subclass, 0, data.ied.buf, data.ied.pos, -1);
    4883             : }
    4884             : 
    4885          53 : static void requirecalltoken_mark_auto(const char *name, int subclass)
    4886             : {
    4887          53 :         struct iax2_user *user = NULL;
    4888          53 :         struct iax2_peer *peer = NULL;
    4889             : 
    4890          53 :         if (ast_strlen_zero(name)) {
    4891           7 :                 return; /* no username given */
    4892             :         }
    4893             :

    4895           0 :                 user->calltoken_required = CALLTOKEN_YES;
    4896          46 :         } else if ((subclass != IAX_COMMAND_NEW) && (peer = find_peer(name, 1)) && (peer->calltoken_required == CALLTOKEN_AUTO)) {

    4901           0 :                 peer_unref(peer);
