    4907             : 
    4908             : /*!
    4909             :  * \internal
    4910             :  *
    4911             :  * \brief handles calltoken logic for a received iax_frame.
    4912             :  *
    4913             :  * \note frametype must be AST_FRAME_IAX.
    4914             :  *
    4915             :  * \note
    4916             :  * Three different cases are possible here.
    4917             :  * Case 1. An empty calltoken is provided. This means the client supports
    4918             :  *         calltokens but has not yet received one from us.  In this case
    4919             :  *         a full calltoken IE is created and sent in a calltoken fullframe.
    4920             :  * Case 2. A full calltoken is received and must be checked for validity.
    4921             :  * Case 3. No calltoken is received indicating that the client does not
    4922             :  *         support calltokens.  In this case it is up to the configuration
    4923             :  *         to decide how this should be handled (reject or permit without calltoken)
    4924             :  */
    4925         106 : static int handle_call_token(struct ast_iax2_full_hdr *fh, struct iax_ies *ies,
    4926             :                 struct ast_sockaddr *addr, int fd)
    4927             : {
    4928             : #define CALLTOKEN_HASH_FORMAT "%s%u%d"  /* address + port + ts + randomcalldata */
    4929             : #define CALLTOKEN_IE_FORMAT   "%u?%s"     /* time + ? + (40 char hash) */
    4930         106 :         struct ast_str *buf = ast_str_alloca(256);
    4931         106 :         time_t t = time(NULL);
    4932             :         char hash[41]; /* 40 char sha1 hash */
    4933         106 :         int subclass = uncompress_subclass(fh->csub);
    4934             : 
    4935             :         /* ----- Case 1 ----- */
    4936         106 :         if (ies->calltoken && !ies->calltokendata) {  /* empty calltoken is provided, client supports calltokens */
    4937          53 :                 struct iax_ie_data ied = {
    4938             :                         .buf = { 0 },
    4939             :                         .pos = 0,
    4940             :                 };
    4941             : 
    4942             :                 /* create the hash with their address data and our timestamp */
    4943          53 :                 ast_str_set(&buf, 0, CALLTOKEN_HASH_FORMAT, ast_sockaddr_stringify(addr), (unsigned int) t, randomcalltokendata);
    4944          53 :                 ast_sha1_hash(hash, ast_str_buffer(buf));
    4945             : 
    4946          53 :                 ast_str_set(&buf, 0, CALLTOKEN_IE_FORMAT, (unsigned int) t, hash);
    4947          53 :                 iax_ie_append_str(&ied, IAX_IE_CALLTOKEN, ast_str_buffer(buf));
    4948          53 :                 send_apathetic_reply(1, ntohs(fh->scallno), addr, IAX_COMMAND_CALLTOKEN, ntohl(fh->ts), fh->iseqno + 1, fd, &ied);
    4949             : 
    4950          53 :                 return 1;
    4951             : 
    4952             :         /* ----- Case 2 ----- */
    4953          53 :         } else if (ies->calltoken && ies->calltokendata) { /* calltoken received, check to see if it is valid */
    4954          53 :                 char *rec_hash = NULL;    /* the received hash, make sure it matches with ours. */
    4955          53 :                 char *rec_ts = NULL;      /* received timestamp */
    4956             :                 unsigned int rec_time;  /* received time_t */
    4957             : 
    4958             :                 /* split the timestamp from the hash data */
    4959          53 :                 rec_hash = strchr((char *) ies->calltokendata, '?');
    4960          53 :                 if (rec_hash) {
    4961          53 :                         *rec_hash++ = '\0';
    4962          53 :                         rec_ts = (char *) ies->calltokendata;
    4963             :                 }
    4964             : 
    4965             :                 /* check that we have valid data before we do any comparisons */
    4966          53 :                 if (!rec_hash || !rec_ts) {
    4967           0 :                         goto reject;
    4968          53 :                 } else if (sscanf(rec_ts, "%u", &rec_time) != 1) {
    4969           0 :                         goto reject;
    4970             :                 }
    4971             : 
    4972             :                 /* create a hash with their address and the _TOKEN'S_ timestamp */
    4973          53 :                 ast_str_set(&buf, 0, CALLTOKEN_HASH_FORMAT, ast_sockaddr_stringify(addr), (unsigned int) rec_time, randomcalltokendata);
    4974          53 :                 ast_sha1_hash(hash, ast_str_buffer(buf));
    4975             : 
    4976             :                 /* compare hashes and then check timestamp delay */
    4977          53 :                 if (strcmp(hash, rec_hash)) {
    4978           0 :                         ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Address %s failed CallToken hash inspection\n", ast_sockaddr_stringify(addr));
    4979           0 :                         goto reject; /* received hash does not match ours, reject */
    4980          53 :                 } else if ((t < rec_time) || ((t - rec_time) >= max_calltoken_delay)) {
    4981           0 :                         ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Too much delay in IAX2 calltoken timestamp from address %s\n", ast_sockaddr_stringify(addr));
    4982           0 :                         goto reject; /* too much delay, reject */
    4983             :                 }
    4984             : 
    4985             :                 /* at this point the call token is valid, returning 0
    4986             :                  * will allow socket_process to continue as usual */
    4987          53 :                 requirecalltoken_mark_auto(ies->username, subclass);
    4988          53 :                 return 0;
    4989             : 
    4990             :         /* ----- Case 3 ----- */
    4991             :         } else { /* calltokens are not supported for this client, how do we respond? */
    4992           0 :                 if (calltoken_required(addr, ies->username, subclass)) {
    4993           0 :                         ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Call rejected, CallToken Support required. If unexpected, resolve by placing address %s in the calltokenoptional list or setting user %s requirecalltoken=no\n", ast_sockaddr_stringify(addr), S_OR(ies->username, "guest"));
    4994           0 :                         goto reject;
    4995             :                 }
    4996           0 :                 return 0; /* calltoken is not required for this addr, so permit it. */
    4997             :         }
    4998             : 
    4999           0 : reject:
    5000             :         /* received frame has failed calltoken inspection, send apathetic reject messages */
    5001           0 :         if (subclass == IAX_COMMAND_REGREQ || subclass == IAX_COMMAND_REGREL) {
    5002           0 :                 send_apathetic_reply(1, ntohs(fh->scallno), addr, IAX_COMMAND_REGREJ, ntohl(fh->ts), fh->iseqno + 1, fd, NULL);
    5003             :         } else {
    5004           0 :                 send_apathetic_reply(1, ntohs(fh->scallno), addr, IAX_COMMAND_REJECT, ntohl(fh->ts), fh->iseqno + 1, fd, NULL);
    5005             :         }
    5006             : 
    5007           0 :         return 1;
    5008             : }
    5009             : 
    5010             : /*!
    5011             :  * \brief Parses an IAX dial string into its component parts.
    5012             :  * \param data the string to be parsed
    5013             :  * \param pds pointer to a \c struct \c parsed_dial_string to be filled in
    5014             :  * \return nothing
    5015             :  *
    5016             :  * This function parses the string and fills the structure
    5017             :  * with pointers to its component parts. The input string
    5018             :  * will be modified.
    5019             :  *
    5020             :  * \note This function supports both plaintext passwords and RSA
    5021             :  * key names; if the password string is formatted as '[keyname]',
    5022             :  * then the keyname will be placed into the key field, and the
    5023             :  * password field will be set to NULL.
    5024             :  *
    5025             :  * \note The dial string format is:
    5026             :  *       [username[:password]@]peer[:port][/exten[@context]][/options]
    5027             :  */
    5028         302 : static void parse_dial_string(char *data, struct parsed_dial_string *pds)
    5029             : {
    5030         302 :         if (ast_strlen_zero(data))
    5031           0 :                 return;
    5032             : 
    5033         302 :         pds->peer = strsep(&data, "/");
    5034         302 :         pds->exten = strsep(&data, "/");
    5035         302 :         pds->options = data;
    5036             : 
    5037         302 :         if (pds->exten) {
    5038          96 :                 data = pds->exten;
    5039          96 :                 pds->exten = strsep(&data, "@");
    5040          96 :                 pds->context = data;
    5041             :         }
    5042             : 
    5043         302 :         if (strchr(pds->peer, '@')) {
    5044          42 :                 data = pds->peer;
    5045          42 :                 pds->username = strsep(&data, "@");
    5046          42 :                 pds->peer = data;
    5047             :         }
    5048             : 
    5049         302 :         if (pds->username) {
    5050          42 :                 data = pds->username;
    5051          42 :                 pds->username = strsep(&data, ":");
    5052          42 :                 pds->password = data;
    5053             :         }
    5054             : 
    5055         302 :         data = pds->peer;
    5056         302 :         pds->peer = strsep(&data, ":");
    5057         302 :         pds->port = data;
    5058             : 
    5059             :         /*
    5060             :          * Check for a key name wrapped in [] in the password position.
    5061             :          * If found, move it to the key field instead.
    5062             :          */
    5063         302 :         if (pds->password && (pds->password[0] == '[')) {
    5064           0 :                 pds->key = ast_strip_quoted(pds->password, "[", "]");
    5065           0 :                 pds->password = NULL;
    5066             :         }
    5067             : }
    5068             : 
    5069          53 : static int iax2_call(struct ast_channel *c, const char *dest, int timeout)
    5070             : {
    5071             :         struct ast_sockaddr addr;
    5072          53 :         char *l=NULL, *n=NULL, *tmpstr;
    5073             :         struct iax_ie_data ied;
    5074          53 :         char *defaultrdest = "s";
    5075          53 :         unsigned short callno = PTR_TO_CALLNO(ast_channel_tech_pvt(c));
    5076             :         struct parsed_dial_string pds;
    5077             :         struct create_addr_info cai;
    5078             :         struct ast_var_t *var;
    5079          53 :         struct ast_datastore *variablestore = ast_channel_datastore_find(c, &iax2_variable_datastore_info, NULL);
    5080             :         const char* osp_token_ptr;
    5081             :         unsigned int osp_token_length;
    5082             :         unsigned char osp_block_index;
    5083             :         unsigned int osp_block_length;
    5084             :         unsigned char osp_buffer[256];
    5085             :         char encoded_prefs[32];
    5086             :         iax2_format iax2_tmpfmt;
    5087             : 
    5088          53 :         if ((ast_channel_state(c) != AST_STATE_DOWN) && (ast_channel_state(c) != AST_STATE_RESERVED)) {
    5089           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Channel is already in use (%s)?\n", ast_channel_name(c));
    5090           0 :                 return -1;
    5091             :         }
    5092             : 
    5093          53 :         memset(&cai, 0, sizeof(cai));
    5094          53 :         cai.encmethods = iax2_encryption;
    5095             : 
    5096          53 :         memset(&pds, 0, sizeof(pds));
    5097          53 :         tmpstr = ast_strdupa(dest);

    5286          90 : static int iax2_hangup(struct ast_channel *c)
    5287             : {
    5288          90 :         unsigned short callno = PTR_TO_CALLNO(ast_channel_tech_pvt(c));
    5289             :         struct iax_ie_data ied;
    5290             :         int alreadygone;
    5291          90 :         memset(&ied, 0, sizeof(ied));
    5292          90 :         ast_mutex_lock(&iaxsl[callno]);
    5293          90 :         if (callno && iaxs[callno]) {
    5294          90 :                 ast_debug(1, "We're hanging up %s now...\n", ast_channel_name(c));
    5295          90 :                 alreadygone = ast_test_flag64(iaxs[callno], IAX_ALREADYGONE);
    5296             :                 /* Send the hangup unless we have had a transmission error or are already gone */
    5297          90 :                 iax_ie_append_byte(&ied, IAX_IE_CAUSECODE, (unsigned char)ast_channel_hangupcause(c));

    5300           0 :                                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "No final packet could be sent for callno %d\n", callno);
    5301             :                         }
    5302          52 :                         if (!iaxs[callno]) {
    5303           0 :                                 ast_mutex_unlock(&iaxsl[callno]);
    5304           0 :                                 return 0;
    5305             :                         }
    5306             :                 }
    5307             :                 /* Explicitly predestroy it */
    5308          90 :                 iax2_predestroy(callno);
    5309             :                 /* If we were already gone to begin with, destroy us now */
    5310         180 :                 if (iaxs[callno] && alreadygone) {
    5311          38 :                         ast_debug(1, "Really destroying %s now...\n", ast_channel_name(c));
    5312          38 :                         iax2_destroy(callno);
    5313          52 :                 } else if (iaxs[callno]) {
    5314          52 :                         if (ast_sched_add(sched, 10000, scheduled_destroy, CALLNO_TO_PTR(callno)) < 0) {
    5315           0 :                                 ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Unable to schedule iax2 callno %d destruction?!!  Destroying immediately.\n", callno);

    5317             :                         }

    5319           0 :         } else if (ast_channel_tech_pvt(c)) {
    5320             :                 /* If this call no longer exists, but the channel still

    5480             : #if defined(IAX2_NATIVE_BRIDGING)
    5481             : static int iax2_start_transfer(unsigned short callno0, unsigned short callno1, int mediaonly)
    5482             : {

    5484             :         struct iax_ie_data ied0;
    5485             :         struct iax_ie_data ied1;
    5486             :         unsigned int transferid = (unsigned int)ast_random();

    5490             :                 ast_set_flag64(iaxs[callno0], IAX_NOTRANSFER);
    5491             :                 ast_set_flag64(iaxs[callno1], IAX_NOTRANSFER);
    5492             :                 return 0;
    5493             :         }
    5494             : 
    5495             :         memset(&ied0, 0, sizeof(ied0));

    6013           0 : static unsigned int calc_txpeerstamp(struct iax2_trunk_peer *tpeer, int sampms, struct timeval *now)

    6056             : 
    6057       20419 : static unsigned int calc_timestamp(struct chan_iax2_pvt *p, unsigned int ts, struct ast_frame *f)
    6058             : {
    6059             :         int ms;
    6060       20419 :         int voice = 0;
    6061       20419 :         int genuine = 0;
    6062             :         int adjust;
    6063       20419 :         int rate = 0;
    6064       20419 :         struct timeval *delivery = NULL;
    6065             : 
    6066             : 
    6067             :         /* What sort of frame do we have?: voice is self-explanatory
    6068             :            "genuine" means an IAX frame - things like LAGRQ/RP, PING/PONG, ACK
    6069             :            non-genuine frames are CONTROL frames [ringing etc], DTMF
    6070             :            The "genuine" distinction is needed because genuine frames must get a clock-based timestamp,
    6071             :            the others need a timestamp slaved to the voice frames so that they go in sequence
    6072             :         */
    6073       20419 :         if (f->frametype == AST_FRAME_VOICE) {
    6074       19266 :                 voice = 1;
    6075       19266 :                 rate = ast_format_get_sample_rate(f->subclass.format) / 1000;
    6076       19266 :                 delivery = &f->delivery;
    6077        1153 :         } else if (f->frametype == AST_FRAME_IAX) {
    6078         864 :                 genuine = 1;
    6079         289 :         } else if (f->frametype == AST_FRAME_CNG) {
    6080           0 :                 p->notsilenttx = 0;
    6081             :         }
    6082             : 
    6083       20419 :         if (ast_tvzero(p->offset)) {
    6084         106 :                 p->offset = ast_tvnow();
    6085             :                 /* Round to nearest 20ms for nice looking traces */
    6086         106 :                 p->offset.tv_usec -= p->offset.tv_usec % 20000;
    6087             :         }
    6088             :         /* If the timestamp is specified, just send it as is */
    6089       20419 :         if (ts)
    6090         509 :                 return ts;
    6091             :         /* If we have a time that the frame arrived, always use it to make our timestamp */
    6092       19910 :         if (delivery && !ast_tvzero(*delivery)) {
    6093           0 :                 ms = ast_tvdiff_ms(*delivery, p->offset);
    6094           0 :                 if (ms < 0) {
    6095           0 :                         ms = 0;
    6096             :                 }
    6097           0 :                 if (iaxdebug)
    6098           0 :                         ast_debug(3, "calc_timestamp: call %d/%d: Timestamp slaved to delivery time\n", p->callno, iaxs[p->callno]->peercallno);
    6099             :         } else {
    6100       19910 :                 ms = ast_tvdiff_ms(ast_tvnow(), p->offset);
    6101       19910 :                 if (ms < 0)
    6102           0 :                         ms = 0;
    6103       19910 :                 if (voice) {
    6104             :                         /* On a voice frame, use predicted values if appropriate */
    6105       19266 :                         adjust = (ms - p->nextpred);
    6106       19266 :                         if (p->notsilenttx && abs(adjust) <= MAX_TIMESTAMP_SKEW) {
    6107             :                                 /* Adjust our txcore, keeping voice and non-voice synchronized */
    6108             :                                 /* AN EXPLANATION:
    6109             :                                    When we send voice, we usually send "calculated" timestamps worked out
    6110             :                                    on the basis of the number of samples sent. When we send other frames,
    6111             :                                    we usually send timestamps worked out from the real clock.
    6112             :                                    The problem is that they can tend to drift out of step because the
    6113             :                                    source channel's clock and our clock may not be exactly at the same rate.
    6114             :                                    We fix this by continuously "tweaking" p->offset.  p->offset is "time zero"
    6115             :                                    for this call.  Moving it adjusts timestamps for non-voice frames.
    6116             :                                    We make the adjustment in the style of a moving average.  Each time we
    6117             :                                    adjust p->offset by 10% of the difference between our clock-derived
    6118             :                                    timestamp and the predicted timestamp.  That's why you see "10000"
    6119             :                                    below even though IAX2 timestamps are in milliseconds.
    6120             :                                    The use of a moving average avoids offset moving too radically.
    6121             :                                    Generally, "adjust" roams back and forth around 0, with offset hardly
    6122             :                                    changing at all.  But if a consistent different starts to develop it
    6123             :                                    will be eliminated over the course of 10 frames (200-300msecs)
    6124             :                                 */
    6125       19207 :                                 if (adjust < 0)
    6126        1203 :                                         p->offset = ast_tvsub(p->offset, ast_samp2tv(abs(adjust), 10000));
    6127       18004 :                                 else if (adjust > 0)
    6128         230 :                                         p->offset = ast_tvadd(p->offset, ast_samp2tv(adjust, 10000));
    6129             : 
    6130       19207 :                                 if (!p->nextpred) {
    6131           0 :                                         p->nextpred = ms; /*f->samples / rate;*/
    6132           0 :                                         if (p->nextpred <= p->lastsent)
    6133           0 :                                                 p->nextpred = p->lastsent + 3;
    6134             :                                 }
    6135       19207 :                                 ms = p->nextpred;
    6136             :                         } else {
    6137             :                                /* in this case, just use the actual
    6138             :                                 * time, since we're either way off
    6139             :                                 * (shouldn't happen), or we're  ending a
    6140             :                                 * silent period -- and seed the next
    6141             :                                 * predicted time.  Also, round ms to the
    6142             :                                 * next multiple of frame size (so our
    6143             :                                 * silent periods are multiples of
    6144             :                                 * frame size too) */
    6145             : 
    6146          59 :                                 if (iaxdebug && abs(adjust) > MAX_TIMESTAMP_SKEW )
    6147           0 :                                         ast_debug(1, "predicted timestamp skew (%d) > max (%d), using real ts instead.\n",
    6148             :                                                 abs(adjust), MAX_TIMESTAMP_SKEW);
    6149             : 
    6150          59 :                                 if (f->samples >= rate) /* check to make sure we don't core dump */
    6151             :                                 {
    6152          59 :                                         int diff = ms % (f->samples / rate);
    6153          59 :                                         if (diff)
    6154          53 :                                             ms += f->samples/rate - diff;
    6155             :                                 }
    6156             : 
    6157          59 :                                 p->nextpred = ms;
    6158          59 :                                 p->notsilenttx = 1;
    6159             :                         }
    6160         644 :                 } else if ( f->frametype == AST_FRAME_VIDEO ) {
    6161             :                         /*
    6162             :                         * IAX2 draft 03 says that timestamps MUST be in order.
    6163             :                         * It does not say anything about several frames having the same timestamp
    6164             :                         * When transporting video, we can have a frame that spans multiple iax packets
    6165             :                         * (so called slices), so it would make sense to use the same timestamp for all of
    6166             :                         * them
    6167             :                         * We do want to make sure that frames don't go backwards though
    6168             :                         */
    6169           0 :                         if ( (unsigned int)ms < p->lastsent )
    6170           0 :                                 ms = p->lastsent;
    6171             :                 } else {
    6172             :                         /* On a dataframe, use last value + 3 (to accomodate jitter buffer shrinking) if appropriate unless
    6173             :                            it's a genuine frame */
    6174         644 :                         adjust = (ms - p->lastsent);
    6175         644 :                         if (genuine) {
    6176             :                                 /* genuine (IAX LAGRQ etc) must keep their clock-based stamps */
    6177         355 :                                 if (ms <= p->lastsent)
    6178         108 :                                         ms = p->lastsent + 3;
    6179         289 :                         } else if (abs(adjust) <= MAX_TIMESTAMP_SKEW) {
    6180             :                                 /* non-genuine frames (!?) (DTMF, CONTROL) should be pulled into the predicted stream stamps */
    6181         168 :                                 ms = p->lastsent + 3;
    6182             :                         }
    6183             :                 }
    6184             :         }
    6185       19910 :         p->lastsent = ms;
    6186       19910 :         if (voice) {
    6187       19266 :                 p->nextpred = p->nextpred + f->samples / rate;
    6188             :         }
    6189       19910 :         return ms;
    6190             : }
    6191             :

    6338             : 
    6339             : /* IAX2 encryption requires 16 to 32 bytes of random padding to be present
    6340             :  * before the encryption data.  This function randomizes that data. */
    6341          24 : static void build_rand_pad(unsigned char *buf, ssize_t len)
    6342             : {
    6343             :         long tmp;
    6344         120 :         for (tmp = ast_random(); len > 0; tmp = ast_random()) {
    6345          96 :                 memcpy(buf, (unsigned char *) &tmp, (len > sizeof(tmp)) ? sizeof(tmp) : len);
    6346          96 :                 buf += sizeof(tmp);
    6347          96 :                 len -= sizeof(tmp);
    6348             :         }
    6349          24 : }
    6350             : 
    6351          24 : static void build_encryption_keys(const unsigned char *digest, struct chan_iax2_pvt *pvt)
    6352             : {
    6353          24 :         build_ecx_key(digest, pvt);
    6354          24 :         ast_aes_set_decrypt_key(digest, &pvt->dcx);
    6355          24 : }
    6356             : 
    6357          24 : static void build_ecx_key(const unsigned char *digest, struct chan_iax2_pvt *pvt)
    6358             : {
    6359             :         /* it is required to hold the corresponding decrypt key to our encrypt key
    6360             :          * in the pvt struct because queued frames occasionally need to be decrypted and
    6361             :          * re-encrypted when updated for a retransmission */
    6362          24 :         build_rand_pad(pvt->semirand, sizeof(pvt->semirand));
    6363          24 :         ast_aes_set_encrypt_key(digest, &pvt->ecx);
    6364          24 :         ast_aes_set_decrypt_key(digest, &pvt->mydcx);
    6365          24 : }

    6530             : {

    8018          80 : static void merge_encryption(struct chan_iax2_pvt *p, unsigned int enc)
    8019             : {
    8020             :         /* Select exactly one common encryption if there are any */
    8021          80 :         p->encmethods &= enc;
    8022          80 :         if (p->encmethods) {
    8023           0 :                 if (!(p->encmethods & IAX_ENCRYPT_KEYROTATE)){ /* if key rotation is not supported, turn off keyrotation. */

    8028             :                 else
    8029           0 :                         p->encmethods = 0;
    8030             :         }
    8031          80 : }
    8032             : 
    8033             : /*!
    8034             :  * \pre iaxsl[call_num] is locked
    8035             :  *
    8036             :  * \note Since this function calls send_command_final(), the pvt struct for the given
    8037             :  *       call number may disappear while executing this function.

    8390             : /*!
    8391             :  * \note This function calls realtime_peer -> reg_source_db -> iax2_poke_peer -> find_callno,

    8394          40 : static int authenticate_reply(struct chan_iax2_pvt *p, struct ast_sockaddr *addr, struct iax_ies *ies, const char *override, const char *okey)

    8413             :         else

    8415             : 
    8416             :         /* Check for override RSA authentication first */

    8418             :                 /* Normal password authentication */
    8419          24 :                 res = authenticate(p->challenge, override, okey, authmethods, &ied, addr, p);
    8420             :         } else {

    8708             :         }

    8875             : 
    8876           0 : static void __expire_registry(const void *data)
    8877             : {
    8878           0 :         struct iax2_peer *peer = (struct iax2_peer *) data;
    8879           0 :         RAII_VAR(struct ast_json *, blob, NULL, ast_json_unref);
    8880             : 
    8881           0 :         if (!peer)
    8882           0 :                 return;
    8883           0 :         if (peer->expire == -1) {
    8884             :                 /* Removed already (possibly through CLI), ignore */
    8885           0 :                 return;
    8886             :         }
    8887             : 
    8888           0 :         peer->expire = -1;
    8889             : 
    8890           0 :         ast_debug(1, "Expiring registration for peer '%s'\n", peer->name);
    8891           0 :         if (ast_test_flag64((&globalflags), IAX_RTUPDATE) && (ast_test_flag64(peer, IAX_TEMPONLY|IAX_RTCACHEFRIENDS)))
    8892           0 :                 realtime_update_peer(peer->name, &peer->addr, 0);
    8893           0 :         ast_endpoint_set_state(peer->endpoint, AST_ENDPOINT_OFFLINE);
    8894           0 :         blob = ast_json_pack("{s: s, s: s}",
    8895             :                 "peer_status", "Unregistered",
    8896             :                 "cause", "Expired");

    9158           0 : static int registry_authrequest(int callno)
    9159             : {
    9160             :         struct iax_ie_data ied;
    9161             :         struct iax2_peer *p;
    9162             :         char challenge[10];
    9163             :         const char *peer_name;
    9164             :         int sentauthmethod;
    9165             : 
    9166           0 :         peer_name = ast_strdupa(iaxs[callno]->peer);
    9167             : 
    9168             :         /* SLD: third call to find_peer in registration */
    9169           0 :         ast_mutex_unlock(&iaxsl[callno]);
    9170           0 :         if ((p = find_peer(peer_name, 1))) {
    9171           0 :                 last_authmethod = p->authmethods;
    9172             :         }
    9173             : 
    9174           0 :         ast_mutex_lock(&iaxsl[callno]);

    9176           0 :                 goto return_unref;
    9177             : 
    9178           0 :         memset(&ied, 0, sizeof(ied));
    9179             :         /* The selection of which delayed reject is sent may leak information,
    9180             :          * if it sets a static response.  For example, if a host is known to only
    9181             :          * use MD5 authentication, then an RSA response would indicate that the
    9182             :          * peer does not exist, and vice-versa.
    9183             :          * Therefore, we use whatever the last peer used (which may vary over the
    9184             :          * course of a server, which should leak minimal information). */
    9185           0 :         sentauthmethod = p ? p->authmethods : last_authmethod ? last_authmethod : IAX_AUTH_MD5;
    9186           0 :         if (!p) {
    9187           0 :                 iaxs[callno]->authmethods = sentauthmethod;
    9188             :         }
    9189           0 :         iax_ie_append_short(&ied, IAX_IE_AUTHMETHODS, sentauthmethod);

    9191             :                 /* Build the challenge */
    9192           0 :                 snprintf(challenge, sizeof(challenge), "%d", (int)ast_random());
    9193           0 :                 ast_string_field_set(iaxs[callno], challenge, challenge);
    9194           0 :                 iax_ie_append_str(&ied, IAX_IE_CHALLENGE, iaxs[callno]->challenge);
    9195             :         }
    9196           0 :         iax_ie_append_str(&ied, IAX_IE_USERNAME, peer_name);
    9197             : 
    9198           0 : return_unref:

    9200           0 :                 peer_unref(p);
    9201             :         }
    9202             : 
    9203           0 :         return iaxs[callno] ? send_command(iaxs[callno], AST_FRAME_IAX, IAX_COMMAND_REGAUTH, 0, ied.buf, ied.pos, -1) : -1;

    9280           0 : static int auth_reject(const void *data)

    9293             : 
    9294           0 : static int auth_fail(int callno, int failcode)
    9295             : {
    9296             :         /* Schedule sending the authentication failure in one second, to prevent
    9297             :            guessing */
    9298           0 :         if (iaxs[callno]) {
    9299           0 :                 iaxs[callno]->authfail = failcode;
    9300           0 :                 if (delayreject) {
    9301           0 :                         iaxs[callno]->authid = iax2_sched_replace(iaxs[callno]->authid,
    9302           0 :                                 sched, 1000, auth_reject, (void *)(long)callno);
    9303             :                 } else
    9304           0 :                         auth_reject((void *)(long)callno);
    9305             :         }
    9306           0 :         return 0;
    9307             : }

    9323             : 
    9324           0 : static int auto_hangup(const void *data)

    9687             : /*!
    9688             :  * \brief Handle any deferred full frames for this thread

    9690       40967 : static void handle_deferred_full_frames(struct iax2_thread *thread)
    9691             : {
    9692             :         struct iax2_pkt_buf *pkt_buf;
    9693             : 
    9694       40967 :         ast_mutex_lock(&thread->lock);
    9695             : 
    9696       40985 :         while ((pkt_buf = AST_LIST_REMOVE_HEAD(&thread->full_frames, entry))) {
    9697          18 :                 ast_mutex_unlock(&thread->lock);
    9698             : 
    9699          18 :                 thread->buf = pkt_buf->buf;
    9700          18 :                 thread->buf_len = pkt_buf->len;
    9701          18 :                 thread->buf_size = pkt_buf->len + 1;
    9702             : 
    9703          18 :                 socket_process(thread);
    9704             : 
    9705          18 :                 thread->buf = NULL;
    9706          18 :                 ast_free(pkt_buf);
    9707             : 
    9708          18 :                 ast_mutex_lock(&thread->lock);
    9709             :         }
    9710             : 
    9711       40967 :         ast_mutex_unlock(&thread->lock);
    9712       40967 : }
    9713             : 
    9714             : /*!
    9715             :  * \brief Queue the last read full frame for processing by a certain thread
    9716             :  *
    9717             :  * If there are already any full frames queued, they are sorted
    9718             :  * by sequence number.
    9719             :  */
    9720          18 : static void defer_full_frame(struct iax2_thread *from_here, struct iax2_thread *to_here)
    9721             : {
    9722             :         struct iax2_pkt_buf *pkt_buf, *cur_pkt_buf;
    9723             :         struct ast_iax2_full_hdr *fh, *cur_fh;
    9724             : 
    9725          18 :         if (!(pkt_buf = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*pkt_buf) + from_here->buf_len)))
    9726           0 :                 return;
    9727             : 
    9728          18 :         pkt_buf->len = from_here->buf_len;
    9729          18 :         memcpy(pkt_buf->buf, from_here->buf, pkt_buf->len);
    9730             : 
    9731          18 :         fh = (struct ast_iax2_full_hdr *) pkt_buf->buf;
    9732          18 :         ast_mutex_lock(&to_here->lock);
    9733          19 :         AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&to_here->full_frames, cur_pkt_buf, entry) {
    9734           1 :                 cur_fh = (struct ast_iax2_full_hdr *) cur_pkt_buf->buf;
    9735           1 :                 if (fh->oseqno < cur_fh->oseqno) {
    9736           0 :                         AST_LIST_INSERT_BEFORE_CURRENT(pkt_buf, entry);
    9737           0 :                         break;
    9738             :                 }
    9739             :         }
    9740             :         AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END
    9741             : 
    9742          18 :         if (!cur_pkt_buf)
    9743          18 :                 AST_LIST_INSERT_TAIL(&to_here->full_frames, pkt_buf, entry);
    9744             : 
    9745          18 :         to_here->iostate = IAX_IOSTATE_READY;
    9746          18 :         ast_cond_signal(&to_here->cond);
    9747             : 
    9748          18 :         ast_mutex_unlock(&to_here->lock);
    9749             : }

    9751       20230 : static int socket_read(int *id, int fd, short events, void *cbdata)
    9752             : {
    9753             :         struct iax2_thread *thread;
    9754             :         time_t t;

   10161        1158 :                         f.subclass.integer = uncompress_subclass(fh->csub);

   10163             : 
   10164             :                 /* Deal with POKE/PONG without allocating a callno */

   10171           0 :                         return 1;
   10172             :                 }
   10173             : 
   10174        1191 :                 f.datalen = res - sizeof(*fh);

   12345         124 : static int iax2_poke_peer(struct iax2_peer *peer, int heldcall)
   12346             : {

   14035           0 : static int cache_get_callno_locked(const char *data)
   14036             : {
   14037             :         struct ast_sockaddr addr;
   14038             :         int x;
   14039             :         int callno;

   14044             : 
   14045           0 :         for (x = 0; x < ARRAY_LEN(iaxs); x++) {
   14046             :                 /* Look for an *exact match* call.  Once a call is negotiated, it can only

   14108           0 : static struct iax2_dpcache *find_cache(struct ast_channel *chan, const char *data, const char *context, const char *exten, int priority)
   14109             : {
   14110           0 :         struct iax2_dpcache *dp = NULL;

   14116           0 :         AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&dpcache, dp, cache_list) {

   14124             :                 }

   14128             :         AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END;
   14129             : 
   14130           0 :         if (!dp) {
   14131             :                 /* No matching entry.  Create a new one. */

   14145             :                 /* Expires in 30 mins by default */
   14146           0 :                 dp->expiry.tv_sec += iaxdefaultdpcache;

   14158             : 
   14159             :         /* By here we must have a dp */

   14164             :                    for a reply to come back so long as it's pending */

   14166             :                         /* Find an empty slot */

   14168           0 :                                 break;
   14169             :                 }

   14171           0 :                         ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "No more waiter positions available\n");
   14172           0 :                         return NULL;
   14173             :                 }
   14174           0 :                 if (pipe(com)) {
   14175           0 :                         ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to create pipe for comm\n");
   14176           0 :                         return NULL;
   14177             :                 }
   14178           0 :                 dp->waiters[x] = com[1];
   14179             :                 /* Okay, now we wait */
   14180           0 :                 timeout = iaxdefaulttimeout * 1000;
   14181             :                 /* Temporarily unlock */
   14182           0 :                 AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&dpcache);
   14183             :                 /* Defer any dtmf */

   14185           0 :                         old = ast_channel_defer_dtmf(chan);
   14186           0 :                 doabort = 0;
   14187           0 :                 start = ast_tvnow();

   14190           0 :                         if (outfd > -1)
   14191           0 :                                 break;

   14193           0 :                                 continue;
   14194           0 :                         if (!(f = ast_read(c))) {

   14196           0 :                                 break;
   14197             :                         }
   14198           0 :                         ast_frfree(f);

   14202             :                 }

   14212           0 :                         return NULL;
   14213             :                 }
   14214           0 :                 if (!(dp->flags & CACHE_FLAG_TIMEOUT)) {
   14215             :                         /* Now to do non-independent analysis the results of our wait */
   14216           0 :                         if (dp->flags & CACHE_FLAG_PENDING) {
   14217             :                                 /* Still pending... It's a timeout.  Wake everybody up.  Consider it no longer
   14218             :                                    pending.  Don't let it take as long to timeout. */
   14219           0 :                                 dp->flags &= ~CACHE_FLAG_PENDING;
   14220           0 :                                 dp->flags |= CACHE_FLAG_TIMEOUT;
   14221             :                                 /* Expire after only 60 seconds now.  This is designed to help reduce backlog in heavily loaded
   14222             :                                    systems without leaving it unavailable once the server comes back online */

   14226           0 :                                                 if (write(dp->waiters[x], "asdf", 4) < 0) {
   14227           0 :                                                         ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "write() failed: %s\n", strerror(errno));
   14228             :                                                 }
   14229             :                                         }
   14230             :                                 }
   14231             :                         }
   14232             :                 }
   14233             :                 /* Our caller will obtain the rest */
   14234           0 :                 if (!old && chan)
   14235           0 :                         ast_channel_undefer_dtmf(chan);
   14236             :         }
   14237           0 :         return dp;
   14238             : }

   14361           0 : static int function_iaxpeer(struct ast_channel *chan, const char *cmd, char *data, char *buf, size_t len)

   14758             : /*!
   14759             :  * \brief Load the module
   14760             :  *
   14761             :  * Module loading including tests for configuration or dependencies.
   14762             :  * This function can return AST_MODULE_LOAD_FAILURE, AST_MODULE_LOAD_DECLINE,
   14763             :  * or AST_MODULE_LOAD_SUCCESS. If a dependency or environment variable fails
   14764             :  * tests return AST_MODULE_LOAD_FAILURE. If the module can not load the
   14765             :  * configuration file or other non-critical problem return
   14766             :  * AST_MODULE_LOAD_DECLINE. On success return AST_MODULE_LOAD_SUCCESS.
   14767             :  */
   14768        1115 : static int load_module(void)
   14769             : {
   14770             :         static const char config[] = "iax.conf";
   14771        1115 :         int x = 0;
   14772        1115 :         struct iax2_registry *reg = NULL;
   14773             : 
   14774        1115 :         if (!(iax2_tech.capabilities = ast_format_cap_alloc(AST_FORMAT_CAP_FLAG_DEFAULT))) {
   14775           0 :                 return AST_MODULE_LOAD_DECLINE;
   14776             :         }
   14777        1115 :         ast_format_cap_append_by_type(iax2_tech.capabilities, AST_MEDIA_TYPE_UNKNOWN);
   14778             : 
   14779        1115 :         if (load_objects()) {
   14780           0 :                 ao2_ref(iax2_tech.capabilities, -1);
   14781           0 :                 iax2_tech.capabilities = NULL;
   14782           0 :                 return AST_MODULE_LOAD_DECLINE;
   14783             :         }
   14784             : 
   14785        1115 :         memset(iaxs, 0, sizeof(iaxs));
